intro: Dielsiodoxa altimontana, commonly known as the highland dielsiodoxa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean highlands. It belongs to the family Dielsiodoxaceae, which is a small and poorly understood group of plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, tubular flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
